intro: Lagrezia spicata, commonly known as the spicate lagrezia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a velvety texture. Lagrezia spicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
